content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice, simple, and visual puzzle that is beginner-friendly while also having some nice code golfing tricks!

FYI, there is an existing clash with a similar base idea: https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/5741215a81b1803b7823eb1eca5bdaa10ec0. The other clash is much more complex and does not count as a similar clash in my opinion.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the idea and enjoyed the puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I enjoyed this puzzle.

Goal
* Please provide a complete mapping as per my other message below.

Constraints
* Please change 500 to 100 as N never exceeds 100 in the cases.

Modes
* Consider disabling the Reverse mode if the visible tests don't provide enough hints to let players deduce the mapping required for the clash.

Thanks.

How is a "hole" exactly define ?
It was not easy to me to understand what was expected, especially when, from my point of view, the number of holes depends on the font. For example, the "g" has 2 holes in that text but has only one in the proposed solution string.

I agree with @SyntaxSugarRush. Instead of relying on examples, the Goal section should give a complete mapping from letters to hole counts for the purpose of this clash. This other clash may serve as a reference: https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/14469b605b22b1554aa3fc5746dea60ebf37

Also, if the visible tests don't provide enough hints of such mapping, Reverse mode should be disabled.

Thanks for the feedback. I edited my contribution :

* The rules with complete mapping of number of holes in each letter are now well defined.

* I changed the constraints to match with the test cases.

* Reverse mode is now disabled.

My code golfed solution in Python, for my own reference:

i=input
exec('s=i();print(sum(map(s.count,"abdeopqADOPQRggBB")));'*int(i()))
